title: Yukon - Charley Rivers National Preserve: Traveling Trunks
body: × Rate the Lesson Plan             Traveling Trunk Traveling Trunks   Yukon Charley Rivers National Preserve, Gates Of The Arctic National Park & Preserve             Overall Rating  Add your review    If you are looking to enhance your classroom lessons on natural history, check out one of our Traveling Trunks. These trunks are packed with structured curricula to use, along with exciting hands-on items to explore for "hands-on, minds-on" learning. Bring your lessons to life!  Anyone can check out a kit! They are great for home school groups, camps, scout troops, daycare... Educational Resources Brochure (0.8 MB PDF) Borrowing Instructions These Traveling Trunks can be checked out from the Fairbanks Alaska Public Lands Information Center located inside the Morris Thompson Cultural and Visitors Center between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:30. Trunks may be checked out for a two week period and may be reserved up to three months in advance of checkout.  A refundable deposit of $20.00 is required at the time of check-out. The deposit will be refunded upon return of the kits by 4:00 PM on the due date. Your presence is required during check-in.  At a rural school in Alaska?  No problem!  We will ship all of our kits to rural schools. Generally, FAPLIC pays the shipping one way and the school pays the return postage.    Details  Subject: Biology: Animals, Biology: Plants, Conservation, Ecology, Education, Social Studies, Wilderness Keywords: animal, insects, mammal, birds, Gold Rush, Fish, wetlands, boreal forest, owl pellet, trees, tundra, migration, habitat, food web, alaska, adaptation, arctic adaptation type: Traveling Trunk              Lesson Plans  Marine Ecology - Water Testing   Ecology Unit   Nature, Art and Conservation at Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park    Distance Learning  Conservation Career Opportunities for Youth   Great PB & J Debate   School Boards, Busing, and Brown     Field Trips  Winter Ecology Field Trip (Grades 1-2)   Fire Ecology Field Trip   Winter Ecology Field Trip (grades 6-12)    Topics  Hoofin' It! - The Bean Counters: Mark-Recapture   Day 2 of Biodiversity Bee Week: Flower Dissection / Insect Pollination   "Animal Olympics"                     Wildlife:   4-6th Grade
